secText: Vocabulary: beats, Doppler effect, Fourier analysis, fundamental frequency, harmonic, inverted, MIDI, pitch, pure tone, standing wave, superposition, timbre, traveling wave, wave front

STEM Skills:
1. Review simple harmonic motion.
2. Review wave basics.
3. Review frequency.
4. Review temperature.
5. Review ratios.
6. Review fraction bars.
7. Review speed.
8. Review amplitude.
9. Review Newton's third law.
10. Review resonance.
11. Review wavelength.
12. Review wave speed.
13. Review absolute value.

Language Arts Connection: Encourage students to continue recording their thoughts, questions, and vocabulary definitions and sentences in their Science Notebooks. For an explanation of how to incorporate Science Notebooks into your instruction, see Chapter 1 Overview, Part 1.

Writing for Children Ask students to choose one topic from the chapter and write a one-page lesson that a 5th grade student could understand. They must distill the concepts to the most basic level. If time permits, students may want to include visual aids or even short videos.

To further extend the activity, once students have finished their lessons, have them work in groups to revise and rewrite their work. Be sure they consider their purpose, audience, and approach as they revise the lessons.
